meanings.definition: The turned-down corner of a page in a book.
meanings.sent1: I found a lot of dogears in my favorite novel.
meanings.sent2: She always marks her place in the book with dogears.
meanings.sent3: The dogears in the library books made the librarian frown.
meanings.sent4: His love for reading was evident from the dogears in his collection.
meanings.sent5: The dogears in the textbook helped him quickly find important sections.

meanings.definition: To fold down the corner of a page in a book to mark a place.
meanings.sent1: Please don't dogears the pages of the library books.
meanings.sent2: I often dogears the pages of recipes I want to try.
meanings.sent3: She would dogears the pages of her favorite quotes.
meanings.sent4: He would dogears the pages of his study materials for quick reference.
meanings.sent5: Remember to dogears the page where we left off reading.

meanings.definition: To damage the corners of a book by folding them down.
meanings.sent1: Be careful not to dogears the corners of your books.
meanings.sent2: The old book was dogears from years of use.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally dogears the cover of the borrowed book.
meanings.sent4: The dogears on the novel showed how much it was loved.
meanings.sent5: She cringed when she saw someone dogears the pages of the rare book.
